description: This is freeking awesome!
summary: Something is off with the Icon

description:
For what it is, I like it...the gimmick of the retro aesthetic is a fun change-of-pace for sure, and it's done quite well to be honest. I'm actually rather impressed with the variety of built-in effects and options one can configure to suit their tastes.

The problems really however start when you go fully in-depth on these aforementioned features and effects. Even when being very careful and double-checking things many times, you'll notice that you will sometimes have a saved configuration profile or custom 'theme' preset just completely change out of nowhere. I'm not sure what's causing the issue.

Additionally, there are a few features that I wish would be made available which could make this into much more than just a fun toy at the moment -- stuff like optional tabbed window display, a better integrated menu bar (right now it breaks my window display with my desktop environment setup), some more basic features added like colorization, key management, code snippet/gist management or configurable macros (for the times you don't feel like going thru the motions of slapping together an alias)...this would be cool.

All-in-all though I am a fan and I still use it regularly, just for the nostalgia factor if nothing else. Excited to see where this goes.
I think it's great. Some cool retro vibes

This terminal makes me happy. Yes, simply. want to write command on linux terminal, but I hate to write commands in linux before. Long time ago I workerd on an old IBM with amber monitor, and IT IS NOW like once. 100x thanks.

description: Now I use this for my daily scripting.
10 different and interesting profiles. Graphic effects can be customised. Cool.
It looks nice, and you can customize almost everything about it.
No words, just an amazing feeling
Delivered as advertised.
In terms of terminal functionality it is minimal, and the menubars look awful on KDE, but otherwise this is an amazing project. I never thought I'd want to make Linux look like Commodore 64.
Lots and lots of customization options. You can emulate the old-fashioned terminals the way you remember (or imagine) them!
my "dream" came true
Looks really nice
Looks pretty fresh after usual terminals ))

Using this got a feeling of falling inside Tron world for a while. Glorious style. Personally love "Futuristic" profile over the others, though I think anyone could find style suitable of personnal image of analogue terminal. Bravo.
This really makes me want to use terminal more often.
summary: I'm crying with tears of joy

description: A convincing simulation of an old CRT display complete with reflections and artifacts as produced by the scanline, as well as noise. Very clever, brings back memories.
I really love the fonts provided with the program and the visual effects are gorgeous.
This is something I never knew I wanted. Watching dnf package upgrades scroll by on an Apple II display is very fun.
Really nice aesthetic and works just like you would expect any other termiinal emulator.
Like in childhood
One of my favorite termulator emulators. Pairs well with a Nuka Cola and Fallout Radio.

Visually stunning. Yet smooth and very responsive.
The terminal itself (with sane settings) is even usable for work! 
You can change the terminal size.

i used it for 1 year now,
very very cool
I don't know if I can manage to work with this kind of terminal on a daily basis, but it's extremely cool, it brings me back to the ancient days of IT! Thanks for the spectacular job!

It looks amazingly real! I've only checked out the default profile so far, but it was so cool playing with it, I didn't change anything. I remember when my monitor actually looked like this in the 1980's. Like the name says, it's definitely cool and definitely retro!

This looks amazing! Brings back old memories... (To all the old-timers, when the app is open, right-click in the window and change profiles until you see one you remember. COOL doesn't even begin to describe it. Select "Full Screen" to really get the full effect)
Also, it's a real terminal. Typed commands actually work.
I'm in love with this
This app is just great and makes you think about the good old time when computer where just machines :-)

I don't often write reviews, but for this application I have to. The attention to detail is incredible. I should know, as I spent years repairing CRT monochrome monitors and TV's. The versatility and options available are too numerous to mention, and entirely realistic.

The application can be a bit difficult to get installed/running at times (I found the standard install process didn't work, however the standard Snap install did).

Hats off to the person responsible for this beautiful piece of work. I fully anticipate seeing this bit of eye candy being exploited by Hollywood, that's for sure.

description: Really cool stuff!))

This is one of the more interesting and useable terminal programs in the repository. It was a bit gimmicky at first, but then once I realized you could remove the curvature of the screen to 0, it became a totally useable terminal replacement. Lots of settings to control the old screen jitter and bloom. Sure, it doesn't have split screen, but is unqiuely fun and calming too!

Not very practical but fun nonetheless, especially if you're into interactive fiction like the old Infocom games such as Zork. Get Frotz and go to ifdb.tads.org or ifarchive.org to get started with some retro fun!
